Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean, no onsite parking”
Reviews.Author: Sarah H Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: What can I say. It was small but clean and adequate. This is not a luxury hotel...but soooo many places are close to walk to or get a subway to. We walked to the Empire state building, art museum, broadway show, times square. We had no issues with the service or check in or check out. Nice hipster bar downstairs, and pizza shop too. (Not that finding food/drink is ANY issue in NYC. Beds were not super comfy..but were ok. Our issue with this place was that we thought we were getting an excellent deal for 3 nights at 450 bucks...but since it was our first time in NY we didnt think to check for parking...and we had to go to a garage to park the car. We called around several places, and the average parking price was 45-50 bucks per day!! We could have afforded the cute condo apt we saw for 600$ with parking included since that is what we paid anyway :( It would have been better if we took a train in from NJ Princeton and then a cab to the hotel. Cabs arent too expensive. Guess you live and learn.

Reviews.Title: “broken window”
Reviews.Author: Margaret B Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I did not realize until very early in the morning that the window was broken and allowing a draft into the room. I called to complain and the hotel sent extra blankets, but would only offer me to change rooms. my daughter was asleep and i chose to stay in the room because we were leaving so early in the morning. the hotel did not offer any discounts or reimbursements to make my stay better. besides having a very noisy, very drafty room, the hotel was great. the location and price are perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Indecisive”
Reviews.Author: KimberleyG81
Reviews.Content: My first stay at the hotel has been ok. My room wasn't clean, I was told the housekeeper would come to clean, to give them some time. I called the desk back and asked to be placed in another room, they did. The room was cozy but the water was freezing! I transferred to another room the next morning as I decided to stay an extra night. The second room was a double bed room, which cost a bit more. 4am Sunday morning while sleeping my face & ear began to itch, I discovered a bedbug in the bed. I took pictures and brought the bug to the front desk, the night clerk had no idea what to or say about the incident. I asked for rubbing alcohol to clean the bites with, they didn't have any. I asked about the hotel policy on bedbugs, he didnt know about that either . I was told I had to wait to speak to a manager during "manager hours" which are M-F 10-6. I was moved to another room, checked the beds thoroughly one of which had an extreme amount of hair in it. I never went back to sleep and had to check out at 11 am. Overall the cleanliness of the rooms were good, the hot water needs to be tweaked a bit. The employees definitely need to be aware of hotel policy and should have some sort of answer besides " I don't know" during serious situations like this. Management should be available at all times. As a former worker in housekeeping there's always a manager accessible no matter the time.. The desk clerk is an essential to the hotel in my opinion and should be trained to handle situations in a more professional way.. I am by far easy going and i try not to complain much, but bedbugs are not something I would want to leave Park Savoy with. I've stayed in cheaper hotels and have never gotten bitten by any bug..

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: lu_biancooooo
Reviews.Content: Good price for value, Very Clean and comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “itty bitty hotel”
Reviews.Author: mix_mama
Reviews.Content: what a hole in the wall...that how it was looking for the place, just very narrow hotel placed in-between a deli and a nightclub. i mean its small! very narrow stairway,hallways and the elevator is a box with a peep hole! (very slow moving and scary) the room was even smaller then advertised! the queen size bed took up most the room.the bathroom was small but bigger then the room(seriously) and it had wall TV with a writing desk, towel were already used room smelled like tobacco even tho it was a non smoking room and the construction was always going on. the only good things about this hotel was that it had a luggage room to keep your bags if you arrived early or your flight was after 11am so you can explore the city like i did and plus central park was just a block away :)

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel in brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: poshbirdSwindon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location, a block away from Central Park and 5th Avenue, close to the subway and within walking distance of many, many main NY attractions and landmarks. Our room was very basic, a double bed (very comfy), one bedside cabinet and small dressing table with a small walk in wardrobe (4 hangers!) and on suite bathroom. The bathroom looked fairly new and was clean (no bath - just a fixed headed shower). Cleaners came in daily and made up the beds and gave us clean towels. Downsides - window looked directly out to another building which blocked out all natural light, couldn't adjust the radiator or open windows so it was very hot during the night, very noisy from 7.00 a.m. because of construction work going on in the next building. Having said that, the location and cost more than makes up for negative issues - for those not into luxury and expense, it is excellent value for money and perfect for sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: GrahamT01
Reviews.Content: If you're planning a trip to New York City and want a cheaper but clean hotel in an amazing location, look no further. We stayed in room 210 (for 3 nights) which was a single queen size bed and bathroom. We were very pleased with the cleanliness of the room. The bed was fairly comfortable because after a day of walking around manhattan it serves it's purpose to just pass out on. The bathroom was a little bit smaller, but nothing to worry about unless you're extremely picky. The room was quiet save for the noise coming from the street in the morning, but that's to be expected in NYC. The best part about the hotel was the LOCATION! Literally steps from central park and 5th avenue, we just couldn't believe it for the price we paid. Times Square is also within walking distance. All in all it was a great, economical hotel and we would gladly stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Economical and Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: KatRamos
Reviews.Content: Once I found this place in 2010, I won't stay anywhere else in NYC. The location is key! The price is right and yes, the rooms are small but you have your own bathroom, hard to beat for that price in NYC. Very clean and you can store your luggage before check in or after check out which is convenient. We were there during the Thanksgiving parade and to just step out of the hotel and see the parade.

Reviews.Title: “Always as expected!”
Reviews.Author: namma05
Reviews.Content: Yes, the rooms can be small, though we had a two double bed room, (roomier than the single bedrooms), with a nice size bathroom, a full walkin closet & a small fridge! Always very clean, and the location is the best! And continental breakkfast is included every day, plus a one time complimentary drink, at the Italian restaurant next door(which by the way had great food, reasonably priced too). We were half a block from where we watched the Macy's Thanksgiving Parade, which was the reason for our visit this year. We always stay here because of the reliable, clean, & convenient location this hotel has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a traveler on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth S
Reviews.Content: All in all I thought this hotel was great. If you are willing to sacrifice the glitz and glam of the more upscale hotels in NYC and you just need a place to sleep and keep your stuff then this is the place to be. The room was a bit small but I didn't care because I was there only to sleep. It was clean and quiet. The hotel staff were friendly. Bathrooms were clean. They let up check in very early and keep our bags there after checkout while we walked around the city. I did not experience any loud construction work.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: LaurieJ81
Reviews.Content: I have a couple complaints first the BED! one of the most uncomfortable hotel beds I have ever slept in. Lets just say I spent 3 days in NYC and got no sleep. After spending the day/night out all you wanna do is get some good sleep so you can be rested to do it all over again, not the case with this place. My 2nd complaint, having guests... I go out there to spend time with friends, would be nice if 1 was allowed to come up hang out before heading out for awhile but no, I think if the guest thing is an issue then the front desk should have a sign in sheet so they know no extra people are sleeping there. It makes sense for the people traveling from another state just to see people there. Overall its convenient to Central Park and Times SQ. I liked the fact that I could walk to and from Times Sq without taking the subway. Will I stay there again? Maybe in the future, and pay for 2 double beds just so i can have a guest!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Central Park”
Reviews.Author: KarolB
Reviews.Content: Park Savoy was clean, beds were comfortable, included freshly baked muffins & coffee in the morning, staff was very helpful, it was close to many places we like to go in midtown. It also had a very good map of NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Fine if you are a heavy sleeper”
Reviews.Author: TangoBabe
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, easy to find but they only turn the radiators on in October so if you feel the cold or want to dry anything you'll find it cold. The room was extremely noisy. The windows rattled when it rained and construction crews started at 630am. Service was okay. Room was clean but small. If you're supersized you may struggle to fit in the shower in the single room - it was tiny. TV reception was poor. Towels, shampoo etc all provided. Fine as a crash pad or if you're a heavy sleeper

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to crash while in the City”
Reviews.Author: AngelaJNewman
Reviews.Content: It's not fancy, by far, but the Park Savoy is clean and in a great neighborhood. I found the employees all accomodating and friendly. The restaurant/bar nextdoor was awesome, almost wanted to hang out there every night. This place is perfect for someone who is looking for a place to crash while in the City.

Reviews.Title: “A Place to rest your head”
Reviews.Author: Outta_Town_1980
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for the weekend and can't complain. We needed a place to rest our heads (who actually sleeps in NYC) and the Park Savoy provided that at the right price. This hotel is not for those seeking a luxury stay. The room was tiny and old, but clean and there was a window air conditioning unit. The bed was hard and the pillows felt cheap, but who cares for $120/night! The location is perfect - right near the park. We also had no problem with the staff. Everyone was friendly enough. When we said "good morning," they responded, etc... I would recommend this hotel for the budget-conscious traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Great location good price”
Reviews.Author: joao s
Reviews.Content: Staied with my wife 6 nights, great prices, compared to other Manhattan hotels ! The hotel has great location, 1min from Central Park and 10min from Time Square. The room was't very spaci but it was clean and so was the bathroom. The value for $ is great and the only bad thing i can point was the noise ! Windows have no sound isolation, so you can ear EVERY sound on the street ! I definitely recommended earplugs !

Reviews.Title: “Good location, service nightmare”
Reviews.Author: salvete2000
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 7 nights. The reception is a nightmare, never experienced that before in my whoe life and I have been travelling a lot. They simply don t speak to you. no hello, no good-bye. if you have a problem they act and react and no word. The room are dark as they have hardly any window, just to a tiny little slot between two high raise buildings. The aircon is an old one, one of the terrible noisy ones that you cannot switch one at nighttime. the breakfast is supposed to be taken next door in a tiny Italian pizza take away. The have only super dry bagels and bad coffee, thats all. The stuff hardly speaks english as they are from hispanic origin or Italian dencence, anyway they hardly talk to you. no good morning, nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the cost...would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: djenah79
Reviews.Content: I decided to surprise my bf for his birthday with a quick trip to the city, and chose Park Savoy as I was on a budget and TA had decent reviews. Overall, I was really pleased. Our room was actually a decent size (though from the fire escape map, it appeared to be one of the largest rooms on our floor) and was clean. The bathroom was spacious and clean as well. Really, that's all I was looking for - since we checked in, went out, came back at 1-2am then left by 11am. The lampshade was a bit dingy, but the room had a small fridge which I wasn't expecting and found convenient. The AC was fine and kept the room nice and cool...had to turn it off when we woke cuz I was freezing! Construction does start early in the am (think it woke me up around 8:30) and the blinds do nothing to block out the morning sun...so a helpful tip might be to bring some earplugs and a sleep mask...both would have sufficiently solved both issues. I didn't really interact with reception aside from checking in, but I walked in with a smile on my face and they were friendly enough in return. Also, I never did get a voucher for a pastry or muffin or anything, but that didn't really bother me, as I was only expecting one based on what others have mentioned in their reviews. The elevator is really small, and takes a while...but if you are staying on one of the higher floors, I'd recommend waiting for it. :) We did get pizza next door...it was ok. I'd get it again if I was starving. Based on the value for the location (we walked to both Central Park and Times Square, and there are several nearby subway stations) and the cleanliness of the rooms, I would absolutely stay here again, and would recommend others on a budget to do so as well. There are no bells and whistles - it's really just a clean place to lay your head and get in a hot shower, but for the price, it really can't be beat. Another tip - If you are driving into the city, go to nyc.bestparking.com and map out different garages in the area and print coupons to guarantee your price unless you plan on trying to park on the street somewhere. There is a small garage just across the street, but it's a good idea to have back up just in case it gets filled up.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but very sad front office employeessss!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GF F
Reviews.Content: I would not mind going there again if they ever consider changing the Reception day employees.. They were the most unfriendly faces you ever seen.. The rooms, location, cleaners etc. were all ok.. But overall was very displeased with the way the Reception conduct themselves. Seems like they are not happy doing what they do... We had to think twice before asking the reception guy to connect us over a call in our room. On one such instance, the front office reception guy even said that "I cant do this all day". Can you believe that coming from your hotel Reception. They are simply a sorry figure for the hotel. Wish they would consider looking at their standards of customer service OR Service with a smile, some courtesy wouldnt hurt!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Joker502
Reviews.Content: Couldn't ask for a better mid city location. Very basic--no clock, had to ask for hair dryer, extra pillows, but very clean and comfortable. We read reviews about how small the room, but ours was roomy compared to other budget lodgings in NYC. The bathroom also had more than enough room. They give a voucher for coffee and bagel or muffin at place next door, it was very good.Our only problem was the construction next door--they started at 7:15 in the morning with the clanging and saws, so we had to get up a little earlier than planned. We will definatly make this one of our NYC choices!

Reviews.Title: “If reception was manned by cabbages with hats on it would have been a friendlier place”
Reviews.Author: LelaMay
Reviews.Content: Any question we asked at reception was met with a bizarre disinterest, I'd go as far as to say an air of morose apathy pervaded the lobby and its dead-eyed receptionists. My husband, 6 month old baby and I stayed here for three nights; the windows of our room looked directly on to a building site with electric lights shining in on us all night every night. A friend from Montreal who had travelled down especially to be with us tried to contact us via reception fifteen times over two days before they came to our room to give us the message. The room fulfilled the absolute basic need to lay one's head down and sleep (albeit under glaring strip lighting from building site) and freshen up in the bathroom. I don't think it would hurt the staff to perhaps smile on occasion and expand on the "yes" or "no" or "I don't know" answers our most straightforward enquiries were met with.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed after reading positive TA reviews”
Reviews.Author: KeanieKeane
Reviews.Content: Thought I would book a room at this hotel after reading quite a few positive reviews on TripAdvisor. We checked in after travelling for 30 hours, and immediately wanted to check out. The room was tiny and the bed was as hard as a rock. We also found a dirty cotton bud on the floor of the bathroom. Was not what we were expecting after such a long journey. On a more positive note the hotel is in a really good location. If you don't mind a hard bed and a very basic room then this hotel would probably be ok. It just wasn't suitable for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, will be back when in NY!”
Reviews.Author: Stepper950
Reviews.Content: OK, I read the other reviews before we booked this hotel, so I knew what I was getting into. I didn't expect much from the employees either. When we got there, the employee there was rather nice and pleasant. We got checked in and went to our room. Wow! It was small, I read it was small, but its shocking to see it in real life! There is a bed, and the phone was actually sitting on the floor because the phone cord wouldn't reach to the little tiny table in there. It had one table and chair, barely enough room to squeeze by. The bathroom was just as others stated. Extremely small. I couldn't even get my head into the sink because the shower was in the way. The shower was also tight, I kept knocking stuff off the bar in there. After saying all of that, we still enjoyed it because of the location. The location is fantastic! We left every morning about 7am, and didn't even get into our room until midnight every night. We literally got home, took showers, and we were asleep. We weren't in that room more than 7hours a day, so why spend all your money on a hotel room? There are so many places to eat and do around there! Central Park is a block away. Times Square was about a 10min walk. There was a subway station a block away! Even all the stores around us had really cool people! I walked out of our hotel on the street, and started talking to two guys that live in the apartment building next door, they were great! Stood out there for an hour! Like other reviews have said before, this is a "no thrills hotel". Its a bed and a shower, thats about it, nothing more, nothing less. I felt safe there,and when we go back, I plan on staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location and price”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMonkees
Reviews.Content: Best price in town . Clean and safe. Awesome location. No bells and whistles though ...if u just want a room to sleep in this works .... If u expect more than that u will be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Clean and nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Travelfishe
Reviews.Content: Room was clean but small. However, large enough for 2 adults. Bed is confortable. Flatscreen tv had poor reception so we turned it off. Simple complementary breakfast to start the day in the adjacent pizza place. Ask for the coupon at the front desk. Ideally located near Central Park, subway and Time Square. Will stay here again on our next trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; staff ok-good; clean and fairly updated but small room...”
Reviews.Author: aiello06
Reviews.Content: Its one block south of central park....10-minute walk to Times Square. Plenty of resteraunts in the area. Room, tho small (European size), was clean and appeared to be recently updated in the last 3-5 years. We did not spend a lot of time in the room; no mints on the pillow or sheets not turned down at night, we were very comfortable with what it was (a clean, safe room)....Great price ($125/pn). B/L: recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here twice, would do it again!”
Reviews.Author: salchow88
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in January and April for two bridal shows. Perfect for our needs. Small lobby, but friendly, but not overly so, staff. Have to go there to get a hair dryer, and the remote control when checking in. First room was more spacious than the second, but same amenities. Nice little toiletries in the nice LITTLE bathroom! Shower was about the size of a phone booth, but did the job. No tub. Bed was comfortable and adequate. Both times located across from the Jumeirah Essex House, so it gives this hotel a sense of style. Breakfast is small: Pastry or bagel with coffee or tea. No juice. Only one per person, per room, but good for a pick me up to start the day. All in all, a good experience. Close to Columbus Circle, subways, Central Park, and a short walk to Times Square and around the corner from Carnegie Hall. Location can't be beat! Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling value, dismal customer service, "breakfast" is beyond a joke. Avoid at all costs.”
Reviews.Author: londonisbetter
Reviews.Content: We paid $500 for 3 nights at the Park Savoy hotel including breakfast â€“ and this was bought through the hotelâ€™s own website. When we arrived, the hotel staff were very indifferent and never smiled or said hello. The room was dingy with fantastic scenic views of scaffolding. One window had been wedged open to accommodate the air conditioning machine and the gap around the window had been taped up with cardboard and gaffer tape. Pure quality. When we went to the â€œbreakfast roomâ€� on the 6th floor, it was actually one of the hotelâ€™s single bedrooms which had a table with some croissants, bagels and muffins, coffee or tea. There was a hawk like staff member policing customers rudely telling them off if they dared to take more than one bagel, muffin or croissant. We looked around to see where we could eat our breakfast and it quickly transpired that we were actually expected to take our â€˜breakfastâ€™ back to our bedroom on a paper plate, to enjoy the wonderful views of the scaffolding. After complaining to the hotel about their concept of a â€˜breakfastâ€™, we received rude emails and the hotel staff just could not comprehend what the problem was with their service. For $500 for 3 nights, the room and especially the breakfast were shockingly poor value. If you think the US is the land of customer service, think again. We would never recommend this hotel to anyone. Appalling value, dismal customer service, Avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Location is fabulous, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: sjuwill
Reviews.Content: stayed at the Park Savoy based on the price and location....one block from Central Park, Fifth Ave. and the subway...rooms are small but very clean, they are doing construction next door but that did not take away from my stay...there is a lounge(not in the hotel but right out the front entrance) Red 58...what a gem...food was delicious and the price was as reasonable as the hotel, beers for $4 in Manhattan??..would highly recommend the Park Savoy for anyone looking for a great place to stay at reasonable prices and an added bonus of Red 58 to enjoy your meals and downtime

Reviews.Title: “I won't go back”
Reviews.Author: NJM59
Reviews.Content: despite great rates and clean rooms the sour attitude of the front desk staff affects my wanting to return. We would be willing to pay more to have front desk staff say hello or goodbye and thank you for staying here. The housekeeping staff were fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: david_caruana
Reviews.Content: I know of no other hotel better for price and location. Situated within a five minute walk of Central Park, Times Square and the best part of Fifth Avenue, this modest hotel offers a fabulous location for a very, very modest price (typically $130 US per night) with bagel/muffin and coffee/tea included. Located near Carnegie Hall (and the famous Carnegie Deli) immediate access to the Metro makes it easy to reach any part of Manhattan very quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but...”
Reviews.Author: AZCutie
Reviews.Content: Hotels in New York are very expensive. This hotel is not as expensive as some, but there are a few things you should know. We stayed two nights. The room was clean. However, they are constructing an 80-story building right next door. And, they work all night. They have window air conditioning units at the hotel, and they don't block out the construction noise. I have never used the ear plugs I carry with me when I travel, but I used them during our stay. Even ear plugs don't block out all of the noise. I could be wrong, but I think they were running the jackhammer inches from my pillow. Due to the construction, they shut off the water on the street the two nights we were there. The water went off at 12AM and was supposed to be on at 6AM. It did not come on until 8:30AM. The next night, they shut it off at 10 PM. The other problem with the hotel is the electrical plugs. There is one in the entire room. It is located behind the bed, and it is not near a mirror. So, if you want to look in the mirror (or even the glass on a picture), you can't. If you want to charge your cell phone at the same time. Well... good luck. The last item is that if you have a hard time climbing stairs and need an elevator, don't stay here. The elevator took forever to get to our floor every time we needed to use it. The stair wells are steep and not well lit so be careful.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - convenient location - for a steadfast traveller”
Reviews.Author: Jrhea54
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business (single woman). Firstly, all the reviews posted were absolutely correct - I had no surprises. Elevator is slow, they're doing construction next door (starts promptly at 7 am) the staff is, well, just is. Don't expect all the glitz and glamor. I paid $115 a night and had a private bath with a shower. It was clean - didn't hear the neighbors, and yes the AC is noisy. For value, this is a hidden gem. I priced hotels all over town and could stay at the Jane or hotel Penn all with a shared bath (not interested) Hotel Chelsea had a shower and sink (no toilet) but was bound and determined to the find a bargain. This is it. Met a woman from Tokyo who comes in to do the museums and a show - she always stays here. I would stay here again. Reminders and suggestions: 1) Bring your hair dryer (none) 2) Bring a immersion heater and a metal coffee press with coffee and you can do your thing in the am (no coffee pot in the room). I made coffee and had oatmeal each morning for breakfast - cheap! 3) cheap and good meal- get pizza from next door. At $2.50 a slice - great offerings. 4) Bring a neck pillow in your own pillow case. The pillows are hard and lumpy and yes, covered in plastic. 5) Lighting in the bathroom is dim - bring a small lighted vanity mirror if you need it. 6) Bring ear plugs if you're all sensitive to the fan on the AC (I just kept on AC and turned on the fan at night Could grab a cab from outside or the corner - corner, anything and everything that you want! All in all - I'd do again for the $$.

Reviews.Title: “NOT SURE IF POSSIBLE TO BE LESS CUSTOMER FOCUSED”
Reviews.Author: MacqueenSydney
Reviews.Content: Ok, the location is quite good. However, rooms are teeny tiny, the a/c is ancient, and so loud it is impossible to sleep. Beds are quite hard. It's not nearly as good as many other reviewers have said. If you have any back problems, KEEP LOOKING@!! My husband and I are still trying to work out the kinks in our backs after our stay of 2 nights. Also, it is really noisy on the street side. If you don't need lots of sleep, then ok to stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very darn good!”
Reviews.Author: triciaostrom
Reviews.Content: I never write reviews, and never plan to again. But I have to give so much credit to this hotel. This place was great! Yeah, the room is small - so what? It's very clean, room service will come everyday and ask if you want it cleaned! The location is so amazing, one block from central park and one block to the subway on 57th and 7th av! Before i stayed i didnt know what to expect, since i am a clean freak and i demand well service, and this place lived up to my standards and more. Trust me, i would never even take the time of day to write this, but i absolutely had to, if youre looking for a good price and a nice stay, come here! And one of the best things is that on our last day our plane didnt leave til 5 p.m. and we didn't want to haul around heavy bags all day since check out is at 11 a.m. - they have a luggage room specifically for that! It was great, and allowed us to enjoy the last bit in the city. p.s. the air conditioners are not even loud!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good value, right price”
Reviews.Author: CasseyLA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exactly as others reviewed it; very clean small room place in a good location for a good price. The retro bathroom was very clean, hot water pressure no problem, air conditioning worked. A no-frills place whose reasonable cost enabled us to stay in NYC. For a clean, safe place to just sleep and leave, it was fine. Being near subway 1 and R, very convenient, and a Starbucks on back side street for wifi in the am. Our visit was a Saturday night, all my other bids on 3 stars through Priceline had failed. This met our needs and budget. We were allowed to check in early, and leave our bag as we traveled around, that was very appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: SkyBlueBuddha
Reviews.Content: Park Savoy, New York City, was perfect for my teenage daughter and myself for two nights. We had a "clean enough" room, an LCD TV, hot water and cold air. Nice staff. The room wasn't big but we weren't there much except to shower and sleep. Its located only one block from Central Park and within walking distance to Time Square and Lincoln Center in a safe and convenient location. There's a 24 hour food store right up the street that has eveything you need, including affordable, hot, delicious sandwiches, wraps and a chinese food buffet. Keep in mind this place is not fancy. We paid $250.00 for two nights. If you're looking to travel to New York City on a low budget, this place qualifies.

Reviews.Title: “worst bed I've ever slept in.”
Reviews.Author: Yerdua91
Reviews.Content: The two full size beds were crammed into a tiny room. The beds were as hard as a rock. It felt like a boxspring. One member of my group actually slept on the floor because there was more cushion! I slept on the bed and my back hurt the next day. Water pressure was terrible, toilet ran for about 2 hours after you flushed it, the elevator was slow, and the hallways stunk. The tv was of awful quality as well. I would say that this is the hotel for you if you aren't planning on sleeping, bathing, or relaxing on a soft surface after you've been walking all over the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Price”
Reviews.Author: FriendOfWife
Reviews.Content: Good: worth the $106 per night (i.e. $250 for two days incl taxes). Good location (walking distance from theater district) near Central Park, one block from two subway stops. Bad: gives the feel of college dorm, very little water pressure in bathroom shower. Small sized room and bed. If you just have to use the hotel for sleeping purpose only, I won't mind going there again. WiFi Internet is available for $10 per day (or $5 per 30 mts). Staff was nice enough to safe keep our luggage for 5 hours after we checked out. (Note to fellow travellers: Got this price from hotel's site; Priceline and other search sites all quoted very high price).

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION is all”
Reviews.Author: MissHK2009
Reviews.Content: Very good location, next to central park, metro stations are just on the next upper and lower streets. Can walk to Times Square within 15 minutes. Many restaurants/ shops / fast food nearby. Room is spacious but rather dated. There is slit in window area so it's quite chilly inside the room. Staff not rude but nothing more. Price US$141 excl tax is not cheap to me but is already on low side according to New York/USA standard. Overall, as having a cheap but well located accomodation with private bathroom in New York is no way easy, this hotel worth consideraton solely because of its excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “What a Bargain!”
Reviews.Author: nicegirl512
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I headed to NYC for a performance at Carnegie Hall. This hotel is one block from Central Park, one block from Carnegie Hall, and one block from two subway stops, so the location is perfect. Our rate was $146/night, which is a *steal* for New York. At that price, I was afraid it would be divey, but really this is a respectable little budget hotel that should satisfy almost anyone. Staff was friendly and let me check into my room early and they store luggage at no extra charge after checkout (very handy for us). There is an elevator. The room is small but no smaller than average for NYC (or a large European city). It had a mini fridge, which was a bonus. The shower is small but adequate with hot hot water (I take very hot showers so I was happy about that), and the toiletries were surprisingly nice. The pillows were somewhat flat and had a papery crackle (and there were only two), but you get what you pay for and the linens were clean and the bed comfortable. My only caveat: We were on the second floor, and street noise could be clearly heard (cars and pedestrians passing). I am a city girl and this did not affect my ability to fall or stay asleep in any way, but if you are not used to such noise request a room on a higher floor. If you are looking to your wallet and don't need luxury accommodations, I highly recommend the Park Savoy Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Park Savoy”
Reviews.Author: LennetteN
Reviews.Content: Oh boy! We were referred to this little hotel because it had a cash discount and was just out the back door of the Essex House where the designer showcase was being held and where we would be working. It was awful! We froze at night because the ancient heaters weren't working. Then they came and had us change rooms because there was something wrong with the hot water on our floor. There are no fans in the bathrooms so everything is covered with condensation in the mornings and when you take a shower. Pay the extra money and go somewhere else if at all possible. The only saving grace was the Park Blue small plate eatery downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “A clean, functional hotel with a superb location”
Reviews.Author: JFactor10
Reviews.Content: I have to admit, I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel even after reading all the mostly positive reviews. For the money (a little over 100$ a night) the stay was excellent. First of all, the location couldn't be much better. It's right in the heart of midtown where many places are within walking distance and the subway is right next door. The location is very near perfect - though of course people who have money to use for many cab rides it's not as much of an issue. The room was very clean and I saw nothing that troubled me. It wasn't luxurious by any means but the overall impression of the room was neat. Just know that the rooms aren't very big though they are not closet-sized either. They're small and efficient. The bathroom could be a problem for someone since it's quite tiny and slightly inconvenient for taller or larger people but it serves its purpose very well and shouldn't generally be a problem for people willing to stay in these kind of budget hotels. You had to wait for hot water for a while and in general don't expect to take long, warm showers. But again, it got the job done. The hotel is just basically a downstairs corridor with a front desk and then many floors of rooms. The staff was professional and the cleaning staff was both friendly and fast. No complaints whatsoever. There is some sort of construction work going on right next door so for people who demand absolute silence when sleeping it could be a problem after 7am. Also, if you don't want to walk the stairs the elevator is very slow. All in all the hotel is very cosy and functional. It is small but it has certain charm and it is clean. You don't get glamour or any special service and there might be a couple of annoying things for some people but I can recommend this hotel at least for young travelers and solo travelers and in general to people who can adjust and tolerate minor inconveniences. And they are just minor since all the important stuff (in my mind) is very fine. Hopefully I won't regret writing this review since the next time I'm coming to New York I'm going to return to this place and I wish the price hasn't gone up.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: jimfulton
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to Times Square, Central Park. Old hotel with very small rooms, but who goes to NYC to stay in their room?!? This is great place for dropping the luggage and resting your head at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Zero Service, acceptable rooms”
Reviews.Author: RollTheWorld
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 times in the last 3 yrs in this hotel, as the location is just perfect. UNluckily tehre is no service, and the staff don't care about you at all. This is their style. If you are fine with it, and with almost acceptable rooms, than this is it. If you can spend a bit more, I would choose something different.

Reviews.Title: “Clean + Good Rate & Location = True Value for Money!”
Reviews.Author: kayeen
Reviews.Content: WOW the rooms are super clean!! The rooms appear to have been recently upgraded including a flat screen TV. The size of our room was standard size for New York City hotel rooms, so on the small side. The front desk staff were kind and accommodated all our requests. This is a budget hotel, so they do some things differently. You receive your tv remote control at check-in and need to return it to the front desk at check-out and you need to leave a piece of ID with the front desk to obtain a hairdryer. No big deal. It did seem that one needed to turn on the bathroom light in order to obtain hot water. So, we assumed that it is connected to a water heating thing. We could be wrong on that. The location is ideal for Manhattan. We booked a one night stay in conjunction with an Christmas concert we attended at Carnegie Hall which is just around the block from the hotel. We paid $100, which is a super bargain for a Manhattan hotel, and when one considers the location and cleanliness it is an excellent deal. There is construction of a high-rise next to the hotel. There was not activity during our one night stay. However, if you are seeking affordable accommodation and plan to be out and about most of the time the construction would not be an interference.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but Sweet”
Reviews.Author: KatieB5258
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a "standard" room. It was very, very small and the TV has only one channel, but you get what you pay for. I think it was very clean! It was a great place to stay if you are only going for a day or so, like we did. The staff was decently friendly and the area of the hotel was perfect. It seemed like we were right in the center of it all.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but best for those only looking for a place to spend the night”
Reviews.Author: essess27
Reviews.Content: Convenient location walking distance to Times Square + Central Park. Rooms and bathrooms are very small. Loud construction next door on the weekedays.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: dussan
Reviews.Content: First of all â€“ location is excellent. Subway in nearby (less than 5 minutes away), hotel is situated just below Central park near 7th Ave. Our room vas big (2 double beds), bathroom was adequate, but I miss socket for shaving machine. There was small refrigerator and big TV. Room was cleaned every day. What was not so excellent â€“ very slow elevator, but because hotel is small I didnâ€™t wait more than 5 minutes. Breakfast is just to pick coffee and muffin in one room, but I didnâ€™t expect more. They are making new building next to hotel. Noise is strong from 7am to 4pm. After that is ok, but you donâ€™t go to NY to sleep during day.

Reviews.Title: “the hotel is adequate but there is a large, very noisy constuction site next door.”
Reviews.Author: micva
Reviews.Content: There is a very large construction site next door to the hotel - the jack hammers & diggers start at 7am sharp & go until about 4pm every week day. this is a very large project which will go on for some time. the noise reverberates through the hotel & is unbearable. Other than this, which is a major annoyance, the hotel is well located & for the price the rooms are small but adequate. Cleanliness is marginal & staff are generally helpful. Once the construction next door is complete I would recommend the hotel, but not before.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location but not the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: Yorky1
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was perfect, close to Times Square, Central Park , 5th Avenue and Broadway. What could be better. The room was small but adequate and was serviced daily with clean towels and linen. We stayed here in late July and it was very humid, the air conditioning worked but sounded like a traction engine running so only used this when absolutely necessary. It certainly kept one awake at night. Unfortunately there was no hairdryer. The noise from the construction site was right outside our window and started every morning at 7am and continued for the duration of the day, this wasn't too much of a problem as mostly we were not in our room during daylight hours. The lift was slow and small and was out of action on our last day for a short time, slightly concerning as we were on the 9th floor and the thought of carrying our cases down the narrow stairs was not a welcomed thought but it was quickly sorted and up and running again by the time we checked out. The Park Cafe just around the corner is a great place for breakfast, check it out. Overall our stay was pleasant enough but next time we may choose a higher spec hotel just around the corner called "The Wellington"

Reviews.Title: “Small but Functional”
Reviews.Author: wayside40
Reviews.Content: The room was small compared to other hotels that I have stayed at, but for sleeping and resting it was right on. The bathroom was really really small!!!! I am considered to be obese and using the toilet was somewhat difficult, I tried to changed the water stream in the shower, but could not. Another hotel is being built on the same block and construction starts at 7:30 am. The bed was comfortable and it had the plastic pillow and mattress cover, not to much pre-occupation about bed bugs. I would recommend this hotel after the construction of the other one is complete, and since the foundation has not been poured yet, I have no idea when that would be.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Lilithme
Reviews.Content: Although there was this buiding site next to the hotel (actually also right in front of our window) it was a super place to stay. Very close to Central Park and two subway stations. The noise coming from the construction site was loud, of course, but it did not matter that much because who is going to New York and stays in their room anyway? :) They changed the towels everyday and the room was clean and tiny (but it had a TV *g*), but again, as we spent 14 hours per day outside it was no problem at all. The personnel was nice and we even had a nice chat about the hotel's images in the reception. Was really nice and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Construction noise is intolerable”
Reviews.Author: kbh888
Reviews.Content: Construction project immediately next door translates into a persistent noise problem which doesn't go away even if you move to the opposite side of the hotel (we tried this). Looks to be large project which will drag on for months. Hotel may have possibilities once the construction is completed but for now the noise makes the hotel a lousy choice. WAIT!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is great- kyokushinkai team from Serbia”
Reviews.Author: srba
Reviews.Content: I can say only one thing: this hotel is just amazing. Service is great , location is great and the prices are great. I recommend it to everyone :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Rates, Super Value”
Reviews.Author: Mebaka
Reviews.Content: Do I really want to let people in on this hotel? 1. The location was great. Close to Central Park, close to Rockefeller Center, close to several subway lines, close to restaurants, stores and markets. What else can I say? 2. The price was very reasonable for New York. 3. The hotel is older and small. The lobby is essentially the front desk and a hallway. But who needs a lobby? The elevator was old and slow, so I often took the stairs instead. The room was clean, simple and functional. A bit small, but in New York, I am not spending a lot of time in my room. Had a small fridge, which was a blessing, and A/C. The bathroom was small and â€œretroâ€�. Perfectly adequate for its intended purpose. 4. The front staffers were nice and friendly. There was coffee and one (1) muffin for breakfast, free of charge. Overall, itâ€™s not the Ritz, but was a perfectly adequate hotel, with great rates and a great location. Super Value

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price.”
Reviews.Author: leandrobacal
Reviews.Content: I was there for the news year. All the hotels in NY had an abusive price. I was here at trip advisor and saw this hotel I call them and decide to try my lucky there My fist impression is a little door on the street. I was not expecting much. My fist thin about it is the location, the location is great is close to the subway station (less then 1 block) and walkable distance of every major thin on the city. Less then 1.5 mile from Times Square, 5thy avenue and only 1 block of the central park. The hotel in good, clean (that for me is the most important thin), they change the sheets and the towels every day. I was there for 9 nights and had no problem. If you go expecting luxury you will not find it there, but the bed is good, the shower is hot and the heating system is great (that is very important in NY cold). Over all â€“ I really enjoy the hotel. If overcome my expectations. Really recommended for person that want to enjoy NY and not be at the hotel, because I only went to the hotel to sleep, and for this it was more the enough.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel that Ihave been ever in my whole life”
Reviews.Author: benam16
Reviews.Content: Hi my family and I decided to visit Newyork city.We got a deal from an agency called Manhattan tour from Montreal -qc -at 298$ canadian per person, for two night three days including transportation by busgrey hound line. This hotel is probably THe worst hotel in NYcity .Our agency charged 350.00$ can per night which the hotel real value was 145.00US$ per night .All the promotions in theire site were lies .there was no Ac ,heating system which probably was50 -60-years old was not even functionning properly.plus Windows were not insulated.Wehad to sleep covering our self with two blanket while stillwearing our winter coat. freinds I have two words of recommendation for you about PARK SAVOY in New york city.STAY away.You know when I complained at the front desk I was told to f... offand the hotel concierge afer this comment left.I could not do any thing else ,we were not offered another room . I believe this hotel shoulb exposed and even autorithies should take good look in to this hotel and its management. I am still shoked from our experience best regard benam16

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and great price. But don't expect too much.”
Reviews.Author: Ronaldobp
Reviews.Content: This is a great deal. We wanted to stay in a place with good location and good price. As New York is a expensive city, this place fit our expectation. It is so close to Central Park. It is a very simple Hotel where you can only sleep! With horrible breakfast. Again, don't expect more than a place to sleep and leave your luggage. So, if you want to enjoy the New York , paying a cheap price in the heart of the city this is a good tip.

Reviews.Title: “Location/price in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Georgemia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is basic, but it is clean and safe. At the price, for NYC, anyway, it's a good option. There is no real lobby, but the reception is nice enough. The room was small, the sheets clean, but the blankets allergenic. The bathroom was ok, at least it was inside the room. NYC is another universe for hotels, this is a reasonable, clean, safe option, but it is quite basic.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellers123
Reviews.Content: New York City â€“ Hotel Review â€“ Park Savoy Hotel Located downtown New York City. One block from Central Park for the average price of hotels in this city, this was a bargain. Good hotel if all you need is a clean room and good location. Quality of room was good, large size and clean. No Balconey or view. Only view out the window was into a small apartment to see some guy cooking lunch everyday. No lobby really, was just non-existent, was just a small hallway with a desk built into the wall. Very old building, but at same time well kept and maintained. No special amenities offered at hotel other then a small continental breakfast. Basic accommodations â€“ good. Overall would stay here again. Would recommend it for others looking for a good located hotel while saving money.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: NYCtraveler47
Reviews.Content: All I can say is you get what you pay for! Overall the room was clean, but looked nothing like the picture on the website. Perhaps they have not finished renovating all of the rooms. The small window a/c cooled the bed directly in front of it but left the air in the rest of the room stagnant. Because the a/c wasn't sealed into the window frame the traffic noise was quite loud in the room. The shower temperature was not regulated at all. Be prepared to be scalded. They definitely need a second elevator. You wait a long time for the elevator only to find that it is already full (4 person max) often with the maids and laundry baskets. The front desk staff was not helpful at all. We called the front desk for a phone number to a nearby restaurant and were told to look it up in the phone book. When we told the clerk we didn't have a phone book in the room, his response was "oh'? and hung up. Don't bother sending them an email, they don't answer them. By the way, they do offer a continental breakfast but, apparently the guests aren't told about this upon check-in. The breakfast room looked more like the staff break room and, the room down the hall from us seemed like the maid's lounge. Spend a few more dollars on a better hotel. You won't regret that decision.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for getting around New York”
Reviews.Author: sazbombaz
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to New York, so we were looking forward to seeing the sights and spending minimal time in the hotel. Generally it was a clean and functional hotel, however we didn't feel like the staff were willing to go out of their way to help or be friendly. Luckily we didn't spend too much time in the hotel during the day, so it definitely didn't ruin our experience of New York! The rooms were basic but clean (although our toilet seemed to keep insisting on overflowing!) The maintenance staff tried to fix it but we ended up having to turn off the water supply at the isolating valve! The showers were also a bit ropey and had the tendency to run really hot and then really cold every 10 seconds. Very frustrating! The hotel only had one lift (and a very old one at that!), which didn't seem to work half the time and even when it did, there was only enough room for 3 or 4 people at a push. If you're not so good on stairs, I would recommend either staying somewhere else, or asking for a room on one of the lower floors. It's no fun having to climb 8 flights of stairs with luggage! Breakfast was not included in the price of our stay, however there was a great little Deli at the lower end of the street on Avenue of the Americas which served great bagels, waffles, pancakes and coffee for really cheap, and generous portions too... The heating in the rooms was very difficult to regulate - we were either far too warm or freezing cold as we needed to open the window to help cool the room down. The radiator also seemed to creak and click as the heating came on, but I suppose that's just a symptom of an old system. All in all, we had a great time, but unfortunately the hotel didn't really play much of a part.

Reviews.Title: “small but tolerable”
Reviews.Author: sachris
Reviews.Content: the place was a bit small but with central park being close it made up for the room size. it is true about the water temp, it has a mind of it's own. make sure you plan on a fast shower. my advice , if your a big guy or gal think twice about this hotel. my wife and son (4yrs)shared a full size bed and had no problems. the front desk was helpful and having the pizza place downstairs was great.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay..”
Reviews.Author: branmoof
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to Central Park and a subway station, with a 24 hour grocer nearby. Cheaper than many other hotels in NYC I suppose. Teeny tiny room, which was okay as the SO and I expected. We ended up on the 9th floor, with an elevator that took forever, but got our exercise at times walking up and down those narrow stairs.. The bathroom was SO squishy! There was hardly ANY room to maneuver around without banging into something. No place to put our toiletries, hot water took forever to kick in, loose knobs that ended up falling off, and no ventilation. Old school TV with hardly any channels, and bad reception on the channels that did work. At one point we thought the TV was going down from where it was hooked to the wall. Breakfast only if you stay for a week or more (?). The room seemed clean enough, though dust was noticed in some areas, the towels had a bit of a smell to them. However, the room looked quite rundown. Like others said, no lobby and no service provided by the staff at the front. Very unhelpful most of the time. Overall, okay for a short stay but everything definitely needs an update.. I would pay extra for a more clean and comfortable room next time!

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: stendera69
Reviews.Content: Although i was satisfied with the room and the price 3 years ago, this year (2008) was a real disappointment. The price was much higher, the room worse. It was not clean, I am even not sure if I did get clean towels from the beginning. They smelled not clean and had many stains. The toilet was constantly water pumping, the windows in the rooms could not be open. One part of one window was covered with some kind of wooden tray and just fixed with tape. The bed was horrible. One nigt I came home and found a mouse on the bed, and it came back the night after but I was able to close its hole in the wall. The service was rude, the elevator was the slowest I ever experienced. The price was just too high for such establishment which felt like an overpriced bad hostel. The only good thing is the proximity to Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “beware of bugs”
Reviews.Author: myreview999871
Reviews.Content: Okay little place for the money, but I had a bad experience with bed bugs. I had five bites on my arm, and even caught one little guy in the act...gross. Beware room 407.

Reviews.Title: “Great price & location!!”
Reviews.Author: verolicas69
Reviews.Content: My return to The Park Savoy Hotel was excellent! I made reservations directly through the hotel after my last visit on October 2007. I had requested room #804 because it was a good size room with two great windows and the lady servicing my room did a great job, was very friendly and the Pizza at the restaurant next door is amazing!! This visit my 6'2 tall husband that complains of our own queen bed at home slept very comfortably while at the Savoy and his only challenge was the water temperature fluctuating on him & the slower elevator. I did not have the shower challenge because I take shorter showers. We loved that the Savoy is so close to Central Park & we walked to Times Square easily. We also took the subway on nearby 57th and walked down to Columbus Circle & purchased some items at Whole Foods for the night. We also ate a great family restaurant next door to the dry cleaner my husband took his shirts to. Also the deli/market on the corner of 58th had great breakfast sandwiches. Everyone we came in contact with were very friendly & we will certainly recommend the Park Savoy Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The best value around Central Park”
Reviews.Author: bridget90
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel just outside of Central Park. It is quite small but the price and location more than compensates for it. The staff was friendly and kept our rooms in good shape. The elevator is slow so my companions ended up taking the stairs most of the time. There's a nice continental breakfast in the morning. Overall a cute little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: lltCharleston_Sc
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on your site, I thought this would be a perfectly acceptable hotel for our needs. Our son was singing at Carnegie Hall with his school, and my husband and I just wanted to slip into town for two nights. The location was perfect for this with Carnegie Hall just around the corner. We found the desk clerks to be less than friendly and not at all knowledgeable about simple things like restaurant suggestions. They over charged us initially and told us breakfast was not included, although we did eventually straighten this out. The first night our room was very hot, and we were told to open our windows because they had not turned on the AC yet. There were so many noises from the street that it was difficult to sleep with the windows open. The bed was miserably uncomfortable and very old and hard. The second night was even worse, though. Around midnight, a loud clanging in the wall started. It was a rhythm like a slow jack hammer. We didn't know if this was the pipes or some kind of a pump or what, but the noise never stopped all night. We didn't sleep for a single minute. When I called down to the desk, the clerk said he had no idea what I was talking about. The final straw came when we went downstairs to catch our taxi to the airport. We had asked the front desk to have a taxi for us at 6:00, but instead of a taxi, he had called a limo. We had no interest in paying for a limo, but we had to get to the airport at that point, so we just took it. We were extremely frustrated and exhausted having had little or no sleep both nights. Yes, this hotel is a good price, but you get what you pay for. We would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal if you do not mind tiny spaces”
Reviews.Author: Danius
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week on September, 2007. The room is very tiny but very clean and the furniture seemed to be new. After shooping and with a lot of bags it is hard to move. The bathroom is even tiner than the room. The breakfast is just a few croisants, bagels and muffins with coffee and milk inside the tinest room without any place to seat. There is no lobby at the hotel and when you look the front of the building it seems a little ugly. But we have to consider that the price is very attractive and the location is great, since we just went to the hotel to sleep it was a great deal, specially because it is very clean. We recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here......”
Reviews.Author: stubby29
Reviews.Content: I knew i made a bad choice when we walked in the front door.No lobby just a front desk,checked in and told the elevator was out of order.and no parking discounts The room ( 3rd.floor ) was tiny and dated,with a dated TV that only had 2 stations.The bathroom was tiny and the sink was so small that you didnt have any place to put your personals.I must say that the room was very clean and that the window was stuck open all night 30 degrees out.When i told the front desk about it all i got was sorry i would move you to the 9th.floor but there is no water pressure.Next morning ( no coffee or bagles only if you stay +5 nights ) I found a hotel for 30.00 more a night and ran out of there.For 165.00 with AAA i could not belive the difference.If you want the BASIC bare bones room that is cheap then this for you.I know your not spending much time in your room but to chill for a couple hours there isnt a chair in the room to sit.One more thing great location but....

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Zero Service”
Reviews.Author: kiwitravellers-7
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on previous Trip Advisor reviews and stayed for a week in March 2008. We paid $165 per night for a room with two double beds. The location of the hotel was excellent. The room was small, but clean and comfortable. Yes we had problems with the shower running hot and cold however over the course of the week figured out how to manage this (there is a definite pattern to it!) and so it wasn't a biggie really. There was always hot water available, just the temp regulation wasn't quite 100%. The room had mini fridge and a good selection of bathroom toiletries but no hair dryer. There was some noise from doors of other rooms opening and closing in the wee hours of the morning however no noise from the other rooms per se. The contintental breakfasts were basic but better than I'd expected ie a wide range of pastries, muffins, croissants and bagels, tea and coffee. Our only real disappointment with the Park Savoy was the complete lack of any form of front desk service. The chap who worked evenings was pleasant enough, but the two guys who worked there during the day were decidedly unhelpful with even the most basic requests (ie ie directions to the subway were met with a blank stare, and when I asked to see the White Pages -- the only phone directory in our room was a very dated Yellow Pages -- to look up an address of a shop we wanted to visit, I was told they did not have any telephone directory (?!?!?!). He told me I'd need to purchase a phone card -- you need a phone card to dial out from the rooms a tthe Park Savoy -- and go back up to my room and dial 411). Not a big deal in the whole scheme of things, just a bit disappointing and in stark contrast to our experience with other New Yorkers, who we found went out of their way to be helpful to us throughout our time in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Lucky Find”
Reviews.Author: Princess_Lu
Reviews.Content: I don't know why this hotel ranks so low. As long as you know you're in a budget hotel, it is a wonderful place. In searching for a reasonably priced place in NYC, I looked at almost all of the hotels and B&B's listed in TripAdvisor. Coming from Canada, I was surprised to find that most of the budget hotels had shared bathrooms. Some of them had no elevator, and finding a room with two beds that was reasonably priced was rare. But those were our criteria (elevator, private bathroom, two beds) and to find that within a reasonable price range was very difficult. And to get all that, in a desirable location to boot, well, I consider myself lucky to have found the Park Savoy. The location, as everyone else has said, was perfect. As two women travelling, we felt safe walking at night, the subway was so close and to catch a bus was a half block as well. We could - and did - go anywhere in the city. The 7 day metro card is the best thing NYC could do for tourists. If you have time though, take the bus instead of the subway, as you see so much more. There were plenty of places around to eat, and the pizza place downstairs was good too. As for the hotel, our room was quite a bit larger than I expected. We were in a corner room, 903, and there was plenty of room to walk around. We could have fit a couple cots in there if we had been travelling with more people. We did walk past another double/double when the door was open, and their room was substantially smaller. The room also had a dresser and wardrobe, which is great for longer stays. I liked too that it had a little fridge. We could buy juice or water and keep it cold. The tv didn't work on a lot of channels, but who cares? If I wanted to watch tv, I could stay home. The elevator was slow, but I found it quaint. I've never seen one with a door like that. And slow as it may have been, it beat having to walk up 9 floors! The bathroom was fairly small, but it fit a tub, toilet and sink. What more do you need? Including shampoo & conditioner was great, since it's so hard to travel with it these days. We slept with the windows open, so it was noisy all night no matter what. NYC is a noisy city! We were gone by 9:00 a.m. every day anyways, so as not to waste a minute in this amazing city, and didn't get back to the hotel till 9:00 p.m. or after, so didn't notice construction noise. The maid service was great too. The room was vacuumed every day, and the beds made, and bathrooms cleaned, with fresh towels. One thing I noticed is that most hotels, no matter how much you pay, have kind of rough towels, but these, although not that thick, were very soft. We also had good service from the front desk, with wakeup calls every morning, and calling us when our shuttle arrived. When asked for directions or recommendations, they were always polite and helpful. Lest you think I'm just going to rave about this place, I will mention two small complaints. One was the water in the shower. It went from very cold to very hot, and I couldn't seem to regulate it. Needless to say, I had quick showers. The other is that I couldn't make a collect call from the hotel. They said I needed to buy a five dollar phone card to get an outside line. Of course, I found that you couldn't make collect calls from pay phones either, so I guess it's a NYC thing, and not just the hotel. We solved that by going to the Broadway Visitors Center (about 47th street) and using their free internet to email home. All in all, I would highly recommend the Park Savoy. With an average price of over $300 per night for hotels in NYC, this was a real bargain. Also, when you consider that any sales you get on hotels in NYC are usually only for one or two days of your stay, the fact that their price was consistently low is reason enough. Add to the fact the location, and that it was clean, clean, clean, and you have a terrific bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel in incredible location; however, rooms are poor”
Reviews.Author: chantaklaus
Reviews.Content: As a budget hotel, one can't really expect too much in terms of amenities and perks. Our comfortably-sized room had everything we needed - a private bathroom with towels and soap, a small TV and desk/chair - but not much else. My biggest issues with the Park Savoy is that it's directly adjacent to a large construction site that isn't likely to be finished until 2009. The construction woke me up at around 8AM on a Friday morning, and I had to put on ear plugs to sleep through it. The bottomline is that this hotel is for those looking for an incredibly convenient and safe place to sleep between daily/nightly activities. [ PROS ] * INCREDIBLY CONVENIENT LOCATION. It's1-2 blocks away from FOUR different subway lines, a five minute walk to 5th Ave shopping, and 10-15 minute walk to Times Square. You're within a 20-minute subway ride to all of Midtown, Downtown, and Upper West. * Located in a very safe, upscale neighborhood * Free luggage storage on check-out date * Friendly cleaning service [ CONS ] * Directly adjacent to LARGE CONSTRUCTION SITE UNTIL AT LEAST 2009. Unless you're a deep sleeper, their drills will wake you up. * Ridiculously slow, small elevator. A single, 4-person elevator serves ALL NINE FLOORS. * Very stiff, noisy beds with some of the worst pillows I've ever slept on. * Shower was bipolar; it couldn't stay hot or cold.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Park Savoy”
Reviews.Author: Loups
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at default really becasue we could not find a reasonably priced one at the time. I telephoned the hotel and they had a cancealltion so we got the hotel for 4 nights for $350 we were a little scared as there were some negative reviews about this place, but i can honestly say it was great very clean although a bit on the small side but we were not in NYC to spend time in our room. The only downside was the 1 lift which was out of service on 2 occasions throughout our stay we were on the 9th floor and after 10 hours walking about i nearly cried when we found out it was broke, there is no view apart from another apartment block but it was 1 block away from central park and columbus circle. If you stay here you must go to 6th ave cafe it was gogeous really tasty. Would definately stay here again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Nice cosy place”
Reviews.Author: Zmajica
Reviews.Content: Very nice little hotel two blocks from Central Park; clean, cosy rooms, nice people, helpful stuff, b/b... If you are not a spoiled guest, the most important thing in NYC is where is your hotel settled. We spent wonderful 4 days there!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ijan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well worth considering for a budget traveler in NYC because of its location. Easy access to the subway lines, short walk to Times Square, just a block from the south edge of Central Park -- can't get much better than that. It was clean, bed was comfortable, staff were friendly and helpful. You can sign up for wireless internet for a very reasonable charge; I had wireless for 24 hours for under $10 and having access to internet and email was helpful for me. Yes, the room is tiny and sparsely furnished. The bathroom is tiny too, but it is nice to have a private bath rather than sharing one down the hall. There is a tiny elevator too, but I was on a lower floor so never used it. I just returned from a three-day stay and I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again. The only downside was when I was leaving and asked if it would be possible to store luggage for a few hours after I checked out of the room. The desk clerk said that I could put the luggage in a room and gave me a card swipe for that door. But it was just a guest room and any guest leaving luggage there had access to the room instead of simply having hotel staff watching or accessing the space. I was not comfortable with the arrangement and took my luggage with me.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good room”
Reviews.Author: JojoBrazil
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel during 7 days with my boyfriend. All in all it was a good experience. My travel agent booked it for me, it was the cheapest hotel she could find in Midtown. She had told me it was very simple, but well located and clean, so I didn't have many expectations. The bedroom was good: clean, with a good double bed and heating (you can't control the temperature). Even it was a queen bedroom, it was a little tight for the two of us and our luggage, but I've heard from friends that a big room in NYC is a very rare item. The bathroom had a small tube and a good shower with lots of hot water. They serve breakfast in a very unusual way...You have to pick the food and beverages (bust coffee or tea) in a room and eat it in your own bedroom. They don't serve many itens, but it was enough for us. The staff isn't helpful at all, they simply ignore us!!! They didn't even give us "Good Morning".... One good thing is that they have a luggage room where you can leave all your stuff after the check out, at 11 am. The location is very good - one block from Central Park and one block to a metro station. We walked more or less 10 blocks to get at Times Square, which isn't very much in my opinion. It's not the best hotel in NYC, but for the price I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fmiri
Reviews.Content: I've been with my wife in Park Savoy in the end of november (25 - 28), three nights. I can say that is a very good hotel for the price. It is neither the Hilton nor Sheraton, but it is comfortable. Yes, the room is very small, but in NY you donâ€™t stay so much in the hotel. I was concerned with the bad reviews and also because Iâ€™ve made my reservation by internet, but for me it was a perfect stay. The price was cheaper than all the other hotels with private bathroom (US$135/ night all in); and Iâ€™ve searched a lot. Someone advised about the noise of the construction beside the hotel, but it had ended (maybe soon it will start a building construction). There are 2 metro stations near the hotel, in less than 10 minutes you are in Times Square and the Central Park is just one block away. Regarding the hot water (that Iâ€™ve read here), only in the first day it took a little time to get hot, but I had a hot shower every day. The bathroom was very clean, nothing to complain about it. No problems with the elevator, it is, just as the room, very small, but worked fine. The â€œbreakfastâ€� is a little bit strange, but it was good. One croissant per person and one cup of coffee or tea and bring to your room to eat. Weâ€™ve checked out 10:30AM and the van would pick us only 4:45PM, so weâ€™ve left our luggage in an unattended room. Well, there are others luggages and you as a tourist will not get the others. I was a little bit worried about leaving everything there, but it has a camera that might move away possible thieves. For those who donâ€™t want to spend money with hotel, Park Savoy is a very good option. If one day I return to NY, I would stay again in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend!!!”
Reviews.Author: spaige12
Reviews.Content: I do agree that the hotel was very cheap. Let's just say you get what you pay for!!! I was really worried what the hotel would be like. I do agree that it was very clean. That and the location is great were the only two things we liked about this hotel. The shower did not have warm water. The bed was very hard and we had a terrible time sleeping with the noise and the leaking toilet all night long. The elevator was a piece of work!!! Don't count on that working. The people at the desk were very unfriendly and when we asked for directions he was very rude. I did not expect much going into this hotel but it was not a good experience. We were not there very much at all because of all the sightseeing we did. When we were there it was not comfortable. We stayed there for $175 a night and on Sunday went to the Roosevelt for $183 a night. ( I would highly recommend this hotel!!!) It was fabulous with a great free breakfast. They have specials only for sunday nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & room for price”
Reviews.Author: JenfromOz
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel in a great location. Booking from Australia it seems every hotel in NY has mixed reviews, most with complaints about room size and cleanliness. Park Savoy had more than enough room for my companion & I and our luggage. The bathroom was small and the shower lacked water pressure - but adequate as you don't go to NY to spend time in your room! I would recommend the Park Savoy to everyone as a clean, budget hotel in the heart of Manhatten.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Building Site”
Reviews.Author: The_Elk
Reviews.Content: Certainly a good budget place to stay given the cost of most accommodation in Manhattan. However, there is currently a lot of building work going on to one side of the hotel, so it would be worth confirming your room is ot next to this. Work starts at 7am!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but Has Problems”
Reviews.Author: longbeachgurl
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great and you can't beat the price. I stayed there for $115 in July. The room was small but clean. They were doing construction in the lot where my window faced so it wasn't exactly quiet, but I don't hold that against the hotel. My major issue with the hotel was the lack of secured luggage check (no bell boy services). They have a room inconvienently located on the 7th floor (and 1 very small and s-l-o-w elevator) and everybody piles their stuff in together. The room is unattended. Seeing that I had a laptop computer and some decent jewelry, I wasn't about to put those in an unattended luggage room. So I had to carry that stuff around with me until I could check in. Also, they weren't very accomodating about early check in. All in all, good for budget traveler. I won't probably won't stay there again myself.

Reviews.Title: “"Cheap, clean, good location"”
Reviews.Author: Putuj_sto_vise
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week in Park Savoy hotel end of July 2007. The hotel is cheap, the room was very clean and location is very, very, very good. Room was not small, it was ok. No noise around. There is a basic breakfast with coffee or tea that you take with you. The empolyees said hello when we came and good buy when we were leaving - when they see you coming in or out they do not say hello or anything else. I was happy I could practice my Spanish with people who serves breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Short and Sweet Stay”
Reviews.Author: woman2women
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Savoy 3 nights - July 4, 5, and 6 - but left early at 2 AM to get to the airport. It was our first visit to New York, so we wanted to see a lot in the short time that we had. This location was awesome. 1 block from Central Park and close access to the subways, taxi's etc. The price was even better, though we did not hear about any breakfast deal before we went to New York. As with the other reviews here, the room is very small, the closet proportionately large for the room, but very clean. My boyfriend enjoyed looking down at the construction site every morning so different strokes for diff't folks as they say. I got a real feel for Manhattan staying here... tiny rooms are probably common, and with all of the "grocery/convienience stores offering buffet/salad bars, it is reasonable to see how New Yorkers could live without a kitchen.
