I recommend the Italian/pizza restaurant just west of the hotel on the same side. (next door) I got an arugala salad out of this world and his chicken alfredo was awesome. Also something called garlic knots - these are very tasty. If visiting siteseeing, check out Strawberry Fields in Central Park. We walked down there and right next door to the Strawberry Fields entrance on the west side is a huge apartment building with gaslights and sea serpent railing. The building is called the Dakota. There is a doorman standing outside. Anyways, when leaving Strawberry Fields (a memorial to John Lennon) we noticed only 2 rooms with lights on in the Dakota. One room had the drapes partially open and we saw a HUGE portrait of John Lennon on the wall, about 3 floors up or so. We asked the doorman if Yoko Ono lived there, and he gave us a wry smile and told us he could not reveal the names of any resident. We did not have one bad meal in New York City. We didn't plan and restaurants, just kind of spontaneous choices but it was all good. For great burgers check out Jackson Hole. We saw Spring Awakening and Les Miserables - both I would highly recommend. Bono from U2 was at Spring Awakening that night also. Didn't spend much time in the room. We did have to lean the heavy phonebook up against the cardboard surrounding the window air conditioning because who knows what would fly in - and also very humid outside. Bring a backpack with a cooler. We didn't find any ice machines in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wake up call...”
Reviews.Author: hslama
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great. The room we booked (2 double beds) is extremely small but are you supposed to be outside and visit NYC.... The room was stuffy, just a window air conditioner. We booked a room with private bathroom which was rather old but clean. The hotel is located right next to a construction site. No need for wake up call. The workers start demolishing the buildings around 7 AM. You will be able to start your day bright and early...

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, great location, safe”
Reviews.Author: Mkspangenberg
Reviews.Content: Ok here is probably more then you need to know. but I wish I had this review before my trip to help with booking!!!!! Ok I was so worried. With searching for months because we wanted location and demanded a non shared bathroom and doors that locked correctly.( Hostels worried me greatly) I worried about this place since it seemed to cheap to be true and the location was ideal. And you know what it was? It was just fine! The room is small. We laughed because they had a desk in the room with a chair and we wondered why they did that since the room is so tiny and you can't even sit at the desk because the chair won't fit between the bed and the desk. We had to put the chair up on the desk like we do at school.( Since we are teachers and do that at school) We couldn' t get our luggage in the closet because it did not fit around the bed. We had to pass our luggage over my bed to put in the closet-we laughed so loud but we understand Ny land is at a premuim. Even the ritzy places are tiny!Ok, this was weird- in all communications before we arrived, and there were many, we were told brkfst was included free inthe rate but it actually is not unless you book for a min of five days. ( note this if you are booking and ask about it so you are not surprised later)When I asked about it I got a very rude front desk person who said he didn't care less because my name was not on the list. I was shocked and taken aback by this since I used to work in the service industry and I could not imagine in a million years telling a guest I couldn't care less. When we went back downstairs the second time there were 2 other guys working the desk and both were sweethearts who fixed the problem right away.They called up to the bkfst room and put our name on the list thus redeeming themselves in our eyes. I still don't know how this happened since I had many emails confirming the rates included a daily bkfst with no min stay. That seemed like a big mistake to me since I even had it in writing. Some other things, Ok the closet is bigger then the room which we found amusing and the elevator is right out of a freak show, scary movie like Hostel or something.( take the stairs) The elevator ony fits 4 people. This hotel by far is a great deal!!!!! Clean, the bathroom is great! It did have some mold on the tub which should be a little cleaner. We were very pleased and thought it a super deal for a fantastic location! Enjoy. Ps- it is not fancy but we were expecting nada and got towels, soap, shampoo, etc so Pleasantly surprised! There is no clock in the room though so bring a travel alarm and yes the other person is right, we wanted to make phone calls too and couldn't. We could not figure out why they had a phone and we couldn't even make local calls to NYC restuarants right down the street??????????????This is a no frills, not fancy, but safe place to stay. Don't expect wake up calls and room service but we loved it and would recommend it to all since we spent the money we saved having a blast in NYC!!!!!!!The hotel has heat and air and is clean with no bugs that I saw. Good luck and have a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Cheap!!!”
Reviews.Author: Camila_O
Reviews.Content: I spent ten days at the Park Savoy in the beginning of May. Our room was small but very clean. The hotel is very well located. An excellent deal for the price. They even offer a very basic breakfast. The only thing my husband and I really didn't like was the fact they do not allow us to make phone calls even though we were willing to pay the price they'd charge us for it. I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “clean and cheap!”
Reviews.Author: vickylongisland007
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here for st.patricks day weekend 07which we planned to stay just Saturday and since it was so cheap instead of one night we booked the weekend! the rooms are small and i mean very small but i was impressed by how clean it actually was! great place to stay if your not picky and you want to see nyc! really whos in there room that much anyway? Don't expect anything fancy the hotels actually a bit old along with the rooms and showers but i would defiantly stay here again you get what you pay for! Great location 1 block from central park! see you guys next year or maybe for new years!

Reviews.Title: “Small And Clean”
Reviews.Author: ringomon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last July for a week. The room was small, kept clean, and I didn't see bugs. The t.v. was tiny, so bring along your eyeglasses if you're nearsighted. It was worth the price I paid and it very close to Central Park South, Columbus Circle, and subway lines going up/downtown. I am booking again this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for NY”
Reviews.Author: retse
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in the beginning of March for vacation. The hotel is exactly what is advertised, clean and without frills. The room was very clean, the private bathroom was cleaner than at many 5-star hotels. We got soap and even schampoo and body cream. The towels were changed every day. The room is small but if you want to spend your money on enjoying New York and not dancing in your hotel room, then this is the perfect place. The heating worked well and wasn't noisy. Our only complaint is that the window was drafty. It was very cold in NY and we had to improvise to cover up the window at night. However, the double curtains helped very much. There was plenty of hot water for showers. We booked the room by email and also had breakfast included in the price. The coffee and bagel/muffin were excellent. The staff was very helpful and pleasant. We will use this hotel again. We already gave friends our recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Would not tell a friend”
Reviews.Author: JamesZZ
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights - for a job I had in town, but rooms are really small, didn't seem every clean, elavator didn't work half the time. I would try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Elenute
Reviews.Content: Although our room was TINY, we found that this hotel was in a perfect location and suited our needs for a 2 night stay. We walked to theater, museums, restaurants and best of all Central Park. Transportation in the form of bus and train is just around the corner. Why would you need frills when New York has so much to offer? The only time we spent in our tiny clean room was showering and sleeping. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nasty”
Reviews.Author: sparkggl
Reviews.Content: my husband and i needed a place to stay for one night in nyc and we didn't want to spend a lot of money so i booked a room at the park savoy. at $115 (includes tax), it was definitely the cheapest room i found that's in a good location. boy, did i regret my decision. it's one star for sure. the room is very shabby and old, and the bathroom still gives me nightmares. it took forever for the hot water to get going and the shower is pretty small. the room just made me feel dirty. my husband i stayed out as long as we could to avoid going back to the hotel. if you're used to 3 star + hotels, you most likely won't be able to stay here. i didn't even want to sleep on the bed and i regretted not dishing out an extra $50 for a better hotel. it totally would have been worth it. this hotel is rated pretty low on tripadvisor but i disregarded it and i sure paid the price.

Reviews.Title: “Always Good Value”
Reviews.Author: sdtw
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 years ago and loved it so returned a few weeks ago. So here is the deal - if you want a clean hotel 1 block south of central park for $115 per night then the Park Savoy is the one. Its clean, safe, centrally located and very reasonably priced. If you want a large room you have come to the wrong place, the rooms are very small but clean. At the end of the day we were in New York to see New York not the inside of a hotel room and so the small size didn't bother us too much. Being right in the middle of town and being clean and safe are the big pluses. You can get laundry done across the road at the dry cleaners. We recommend this hotel and we will stay in it again next time we are in New York.

Reviews.Title: “We would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: JFMart
Reviews.Content: My husband, toddler, and I stayed for two nights at the Park Savoy in October 2006. We had read many of the TripAdvisor reviews and expected a very small, clean room. That is exactly what we got. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom, though small, was fine. We were on the second floor, on the front, so it was very noisy at night, especially because there was a buidling being gutted across the street. But, this is going to be an issue most anywhere in Midtown. The small fridge in the room was an unexpected bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine; no serious complaints. I'd return.”
Reviews.Author: Almost_Senior_F
Reviews.Content: I arrived many hours before check in and was allowed to use the luggage storage room--which made a terrible impression on me. Its carpeted floor was covered with paint chips, luggage tags, string, and other debris, and somebody's soda can had been left on some elevated surface. Complaints throughout my brief stay didn't result in any improvement, even though the luggage room would have been easy enough to clean. I was allowed to check in a couple of hours early, and my "petite single room with double bed" was just fine. It was tastefully decorated and quite clean, and it had a decent amount of drawer space and closet space, especially for a small room (which it was). The air conditioner worked fine. The TV seemed to get only a few channels, but that's rock-bottom on my list of priorities. At about 4 p.m. on a Saturday, I called the front desk to complain that I had no hot water. A maintenance man was sent to my room instantly, and he politely demonstrated that it was the old "you just have to let the hot water run for a loooong time" syndrome. He added that it tends to be a problem only in the daytime, when few people are running the water. Does the hotel have an ice machine? No. A soda machine? No. A water fountain? No. Plan accordingly. And don't worry about whether you're going to get the "breakfast," which is a negligible offering. The bed was perfectly comfortable. I heard no outside noise (with the air conditioner on) and no noise from other guests. I did hear a couple of mysterious thumps in the middle of the night, but that's all. I'd certainly return to the Park Savoy, and maybe they'll have cleaned up the luggage room by the time I do. Oh, speaking of returning: Websites (including the hotel's) showed no availability for the date I wanted, but I was able to get a reservation by calling the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fine though Spartan”
Reviews.Author: Marcil1
Reviews.Content: Unlike the most recent reviewers, I did not expect parking, nor hair dryers nor irons. The hotel does not have many amenities. Those which are there (TV, air conditioning, hot shower) worked fine. Rooms are small and the views from my room were of the walls of neighbouring buildings. For a basic bed for the night for someone not intending to spend time in their hotel room, there is no problem. Staff were efficient and co-operative. 2-minute walk to the subway (57th and 7th Ave) and a good all-night deli at 58th and 7th.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: tarbox
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 2 nights ago and it was without a doubt the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. Unfortunately I relied on the good ratings it received. First, I would not consider the place clean In fact I could not bring myself to take my shoes off while in the room. It certainly was a "barebones" hotel, which I knew when I booked however the atmosphere left quite a bit to be desired. I typically book hotels offering only the basics as I don't need the frills, bells and whistles. This place didn't even come close to meeting my basic standard. I booked on a travel site which advertised that the Park Savoy offered free parking. Upon check out I learned this was not the case. Technically this was not the hotel's problem however, most hotels would have covered this cost with a customer request. I requested and presented them the documentation to show the offer that that I thought I had received and they refused to cover my $25 parking fee. Customer service isn't hight on their priority list. If you would like a good night sleep, don't expect it here, It sounded like I was l was at street level withthe windows open. This is not a problem with the service but something to be aware of when booking. If you can't afford anything else stay here. For $60 or $70 more you can find much better hotels. I'd save a little longer and stay elsewhere. Horrible!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect NYC Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cubavetran
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I stayed at the PSH August 4-7th and I honestly think anyone traveling to NYC should definately check this place out. It's in a great midtown location, walking distance to Times Square, shopping, restaurants, subway & Central Park. We stayed in a room with a double bed - the room was clean but small (apparently even if you spend $300 a night the rooms in NY are tiny ) very comfortable for 2 people. Parking lot right beside the hotel is $25 day with hotel validation. Overall great holiday, great hotel and very inexpensive - A couple of the front desk staff could use a personality and manner make-over but not enough to strike against the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, European style hotel”
Reviews.Author: klgwhite
Reviews.Content: This hotel is GREAT! Located directly behind the Essex House and within one block of two subway lines, you couldn't ask for a better location. We had a Queen size room and it was small, but clean. There was plenty of room for our stuff-they even had a full size dresser, chair and mini-refrigerator. The bathroom was definitely small, but fully functional and everything was replenished daily. We stayed for a week, so were entitled to the "breakfast". It was ok, but I wasn't there for the food. There were many, many restaurants within literally a minute's walk and even a great pizza place directly next door. We got breakfast from the bakery or deli and walked across the street to Central Park for our morning picnic every day. The only downsides were that the elevator was really slow and since we were on the eighth floor, it was really too much to walk up. They are doing construction on some of the rooms, so there is a bit of construction noise at times too, but it didn't start too early. It is a rather European feeling hotel-small, older and the staff keeping to themselves, but friendly if you engage them in conversation. I enjoyed it very much and for the price, you couldn't beat it! I would recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again myself!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice with some exceptions”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights. It is a very modest hotel in a superb location. One block away from Central Park! Also one or two blocks from Coumbus Circle, or 57th street where the trains are. Very convenient! Location could not have been better. For this reason alone with the price $115 per night, this should seal the deal! The first three nights, we stayed in a room with dirty carpet, double bed (bed and bathroom were clean), decent shower, but loud neighbors. These people would sounds off early in the morning, and sometimes late at night. So there is sound transmission between rooms at times. I should have complained to the front desk, but did not. That was my fault. The lift was working well when we were there, no complaints about that. THe fourth night, we got a bed with a queen size bed and very quiet neighbors, but the room was facing 58th street, and there was outside noise. Much nicer room though! New paint, new carpet, and bigger bathroom. Form what I know they have rennovated a lot of the rooms. No real hotel amenities, beisde a luggage room, and continental breakfast if u stay 4+ days. All in all, I would go back again. They always seem to have accomodations if u need a cheap good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Yech...loud and no a/c!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: OK...I am reviewing this a bit late. I stayed the first weekend of April, 2005. The hotel is small. I checked in, took the tiny elevator to the floor and room I was in. The room must have been 90 degrees with the heat(a radiator) pumping. I turned off the heat, but asked for a different room. I received a room on a higher floor and switched. The room was comfortable, but I opened the windows as I was warm. There is no A/C, only radiator heating for warmth and you can't adjust the temperature. The window had no screen in it. I had a corner room which had a view of the top floor of the parking garage. If the people looked up and to their right from the lot and the window was open, they could have possible seen me. What I hated the most was the slamming of doors all night. The fire door (the door between the suites of rooms and the elevator and stairways) kept slamming all night with people coming and going. Ear plugs don't work. The walls are very thin. If you want a quiet night sleep and are staying in the summer I would never recommend it. I guess it's ok during the spring and fall if you can handle the noise from the hallway. The back of the bed is to the hallway.

Reviews.Title: “Very Successful Experience”
Reviews.Author: alpinegroove
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Savoy for two nights, February 18-19 @ $85 / Night for a Standard double. Our flight to JFK arrived early in the morning and check-in time was not until 3pm. We arrived at the hotel at 7am and asked to leave our luggage there while we spend the day wandering around the city. We were given a card that allowed access to a small room on the fifth floor where guests may store luggage before checking-in and after checking-out. The room was empty when we dropped off our luggage in the morning. When we picked it up, there were at least ten other pieces of luggage in the room. It is not the safest place to leave personal belongings, as other guests have access to the same room, but we experienced no problems. I would not leave money or anything of great value in that room. We returned at 3pm to check-in. Everything went very smoothly. The room was very small, twice as big as the bed and had a small private bathroom with a toilet, sink, and shower. In the room was a small closet with a few drawers. Everything in the room (and in the building) was very basic and generic. The room was very clean. The toiletâ€™s chain broke in the morning. On the way out, we informed the front-desk clerk, and when we came back in the afternoon, it was fixed. The staff was nice and efficient but not effusive. There is no lobby, just a reception desk. The only thing that bothered us about the place was that the staff smoked in the reception area. The smoke smell at times made its way up the staircase, but it could not be sensed in our room, and we are two people who are very aware of cigarette smoke. On both nights, we had loud neighbors. They were two different parties. We were very tired and slept through it without a problem. It seems to me that this kind of thing can happen in most hotels. The hotel was very conveniently located for our needs: near Central Park, MOMA, Metropolitan Museum, Times Square, 1-2 blocks from the subway). It is around the corner from Carnegie Hall and Carnegie Deli. There are a few fancy bakeries nearby and a 24-hour market with a salad bar.

Reviews.Title: “Horribele, dirty ... but cheap.”
Reviews.Author: NadineInEurope
Reviews.Content: For the money you'd expect a small room, no extras, but clean. This hotel was a lot of things, but not clean. Far from it. We stayed in this hotel December 29 through 30. The original plan was to stay there for New Years & New Years day too, but we left early and were very lucky to find a room in the Holiday Inn on 57th street, an excellent hotel when you're looking for not too expensive, but clean and comfortable rooms. The showers of the Savoy hotel were terrible. The water changed from extremely hot to extremely cold. It was impossible to decently wash my hair. The floor was dirty, as were the uncomfortable beds. The heater was leaking and there was no fire escape. Our view was a wall, and when we had the windows open we could smell the italian pizzaria downstairs. Not so nice in the early morning. We asked if they could fix the shower. They said they would do it, but they never did. We were not the only ones leaving early, we overheard other people leaving early too. I must say, they don't give you any trouble when you decide to leave early. That's the most positive thing about that place. That, and the location, which is quite good. Would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “the hotel was very lovely and sweet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: very nice stay clean friendly. location, location, location.
